{% set recipe = { title: "Banana, oat & seed cookies", img: "banana-oat-and-seed-cookies.jpg", preptime: "10 mins", preptimeschema: "10M", prepadd: "+ cooling time", cooktime: "35 mins", cooktimeschema: "35M", cookadd: "", difficulty: "Easy", serves: "about 15", ctaurl: "", today : "01/09/2019", description: "", keywords: "", cuisine : "Australian" } %} {% set category = { name: 'Lunchbox Ideas', uri: '/inspireandcreate/lunchboxideas' } %} {% block ingridients %}
  • ¾ cups mashed banana
  • ½ cup (65g) Coles Sweetened Dried Cranberries
  • 2 cups (45g) rolled oats
  • ½ cup (40g) shredded coconut
  • 1 tsp mixed spice
  • ¼ cup (60ml) Coles Finest Maple Syrup
  • ¼ cup (60ml) olive oil
  • 2 tbsp pepitas (pumpkin seed kernels)
    • {% endblock %} {% block method %}
    1. Preheat oven to 140°C. Line 2 baking trays with baking paper.
    2. Place the banana, cranberries, oats, coconut, mixed spice, maple syrup and oil in a medium bowl. Stir until well combined.
    3. Drop 2-tablespoon portions of mixture onto the prepared trays. Use damp hands to gently flatten. Sprinkle with pepitas. Bake for 30-35 mins or until firm to the touch and light golden. Set aside on trays to cool. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.
    {% endblock %}
